sentence.Network_en: The hero, Danny, bears an uncanny resemblance to Kirk Douglas.
sentence.Network_cn: 主人公丹尼与柯克·道格拉斯出奇地相像。

sentence.Network_en: Tony was unnerved by the uncanny familiarity of her face.
sentence.Network_cn: 怪异的是，她看起来竟有些面熟，这让托尼心慌意乱。

sentence.Network_en: I had this uncanny feeling that Alice was warning me.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有一种奇怪的感觉：艾丽斯是在警告我。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (originally Scots in the sense 'relating to the occult, malicious'): from un- 'not' + canny

entry.def: If you describe something as uncanny, you mean that it is strange and difficult to explain.

example.ex: The hero, Danny, bears an uncanny resemblance to Kirk Douglas...
example.tran: 主人公丹尼与柯克·道格拉斯出奇地相像。

example.ex: I had this uncanny feeling that Alice was warning me.
example.tran: 我有一种奇怪的感觉：艾丽斯是在警告我。

means.word_mean: 1. suggesting the operation of supernatural influences;

sentences.sentence: "stumps...had uncanny shapes as of monstrous creatures"- John Galsworthy
"he could hear the unearthly scream of some curlew piercing the din"- Henry Kingsley
"his uncanny sense of direction"; (`unco' is chiefly Scottish)

sentences.en: His powers of observation were uncanny.
sentences.cn: 他的观察能力非常惊人。

sentences.en: An uncanny light seemed to be coming from the castle.
sentences.cn: 一道神秘的光像是从古堡中射出的。

sentences.en: an uncanny ability to foresee the future
